Please share the pictures and information with your children. We want them to know us, even if we are starting the year virtually. We are excited to be a part of your family's educational journey.

post_text:
Dear TVCS Families,

Meet the Teacher Night has moved online. Since the school has been designated at "category 3" by the CDH, all our events will be transitioned to an online only format.

This means that we will be contacting you by Thursday, August 13th with information about how to access your teacher, information about your classroom, information about the hybrid and online only models, and more.

Please do not stop by the school on the 13th. We will send all information to you by email.

Thanks,
Josh Noteboom
TVCS Lead Administrator

post_text:
We want to brag about our committed and hardworking staff. 🙂 Did you know that 11 out of our 13 certified teachers from last school year have returned for the new school year?!? The paraprofessionals and office staff have returned too. The big change over the summer was the retirement of Mr. Richard and the hiring of Mr. Noteboom. It is an exciting time to be part of TVCS!

As we approach the first day of school on August 17th, we will be highlighting different members of our TVCS staff. We hope you enjoy getting to know them better. It is going to be an outstanding school year, even if we all have to do it a little bit differently. We know we can do hard things when we synergize together as a community of students, parents and staff!

Be watching tomorrow for the first of our staff highlights.

The school supply lists have been posted on the website. It is a new and improved website! Wohoo! Here is the direct link to the lists:
https://www.thevillagecharter.org/page/supply

If you want to purchase supplies now, just view the supply list as if it was a "typical" school year. Once we know our official plan, we will post any changes to the list, if needed.

For questions, please email info@thevillagecharterschool.org.

post_text: Last evening the TVCS kindergartners met at a park to celebrate their year together. After 3 months of not seeing each other in person, they were so happy and excited to be together. Despite the rain, the evening was filled with much laughter, smiles and fun. Miss Coles and Mrs Laddusaw planned the event so they could all be together one last time before summer break. They had a bike parade, fun awards, ice cream treats and lots of playing together. Many happy memories were made! Now it is time for a healthy and safe summer.
text: Last evening the TVCS kindergartners met at a park to celebrate their year together. After 3 months of not seeing each other in person, they were so happy and excited to be together. Despite the rain, the evening was filled with much laughter, smiles and fun. Miss Coles and Mrs Laddusaw planned the event so they could all be together one last time before summer break. They had a bike parade, fun awards, ice cream treats and lots of playing together. Many happy memories were made! Now it is time for a healthy and safe summer.

post_text: Mayor McLean had planned on visiting our 3rd grade students at school today. However, since the school is doing distance learning she joined us for a Zoom call instead. Students shared the 7 Habits with her and asked some great questions about being a leader for our city. Thank you Mayor for spending the morning with our students.

May 20 at 10:49 AM ·

shared_text:
Idaho State Department of Education
May 1 at 4:27 PM ·

Teacher Appreciation Week, May 4-8, starts next Monday! This is a wonderful opportunity to let a special teacher know how appreciated they are and how much they are missed! Visit our Teacher Appreciation Toolkit to help you celebrate teachers: https://www.sde.idaho.gov/communications/teacher-appreciation-toolkit.html

And join our "Celebrate Idaho Teachers" Facebook Group: https://www.facebook.com/groups/CelebrateIdahoTeachers/

post_text: The Village Charter School has extraordinary teachers and leaders. Our students thrive under the leadership of their teachers. We appreciate each teacher and staff member at TVCS. ‪#‎LeaderInMe‬
shared_text:
Leader in Me
May 4 at 1:45 PM ·

As we kick off this week of celebration, we wanted to start with this: to ALL the teachers, THANK YOU! Each of you do so much more than we'll ever know to help your students grow, learn, and stay safe. You have figured out innovative ways to connect and inspire virtually, and keep your classroom communities intact. We honor your work and celebrate you every week! But this week has prizes! :)

#Education #TeacherAppreciation #TeacherAppreciationWeek #LeaderinMe #LeadThroughChange #Education Matters #LiM

post_text:
Early Spring Break Beginning March 16th - April 2nd

The Village Charter School Board of Trustees, upon the recommendation of Administration, Staff and Families, has voted to begin Spring Break a week early due to COVID-19 concerns. Instruction will tentatively resume April 6th potentially including 1-2 weeks of distance learning. We will be sending out a detailed announcement soon via email, Facebook and our website.

Thank you all for your continued support.
text:
Early Spring Break Beginning March 16th - April 2nd

The Village Charter School Board of Trustees, upon the recommendation of Administration, Staff and Families, has voted to begin Spring Break a week early due to COVID-19 concerns. Instruction will tentatively resume April 6th potentially including 1-2 weeks of distance learning. We will be sending out a detailed announcement soon via email, Facebook and our website.

Thank you all for your continued support.

post_text:
COVID-19 Update - In a Memo sent March 14th 3PM, Lead Administrator Anthony Richard has canceled classes for Monday, March 16th for deep cleaning of the school. Patrons please check your email communication for more information and please stay tuned for updates.

Decisions about the remaining time before Spring Break on Friday are actively being made, we intend to update you as soon as possible.

Thank you for your cooperation in these challenging times.

post_text:
The Village Charter School is a tuition-free public Leadership School located in Boise, Idaho serving students from kindergarten through eighth grade.

We are CULTIVATING CRITICAL THINKERS & CONFIDENT LEADERS!

Your child is a leader! They might not know it yet, but don't worry, we will help you to bring it out in them! It's just what we do!
text:

post_text:
Thursday, December 19th is TVCS’ traditional Winter Celebration. It is a day for the students to dress up in their "fancy" clothes, something they might wear to church, a wedding, or a nice restaurant. Christmas sweaters are also perfect.If students do not want to dress up, that is okay. They will wear their regular school attire because it is not a dress down day.

Parents are invited to their child's classroom for their Winter Celebration. Not sure what time your child's celebration is at? Please contact your teacher directly. We are excited to celebrate all the learning and engagement that has been happening in classrooms this semester!

post_text:
Dear Parents and Guardians,
Recently the State of Idaho received notification of a state wide bomb threat targeted at schools and
airports. The threat was not specific to any schools or locations. We deemed that the threat was not
credible to our school, but always find it best to err on the side of caution. Our first step was for
school administration to complete a perimeter check, which was done upon our becoming aware of
the stated threat, and all school areas were found to be secure. Next we have notified all staff to
practice additional vigilance in and around the campus and to notify administration immediately if
there are any questionable factors observed during the current day and going forward this week.
That said, presently we can state all classrooms and the general campus are safe. As always the
safety of students and staff are on the forefront of our minds and appreciate your support. If you still
have any questions, please contact our school administration directly.
Thank you,
Tony Richard
Principal
text:

credible to our school, but always find it best to err on the side of caution. Our first step was for
school administration to complete a perimeter check, which was done upon our becoming aware of
the stated threat, and all school areas were found to be secure. Next we have notified all staff to
practice additional vigilance in and around the campus and to notify administration immediately if
there are any questionable factors observed during the current day and going forward this week.
That said, presently we can state all classrooms and the general campus are safe. As always the
safety of students and staff are on the forefront of our minds and appreciate your support. If you still
have any questions, please contact our school administration directly.
Thank you,
Tony Richard
Principal

There remain some limited open spaces in most grades! If you know of a child who can benefit from exploring their potential at The Village Charter School, now is a good time to lock in their future without the uncertainty of waiting on lottery results. Please share this post so that we can share our Village! Click the link below to learn more:

https://www.thevillagecharter.org/

Critical Thinkers and Confident Leaders
TVCS is a K-8 free public charter school promoting a safe, supportive and loving environment. Our community inspires students to grow their individual gifts and abilities, equipping them to discover meaningful value and purpose in the world.

post_text:
IMPORTANT INFORMATION REGARDING PARKING FOR THURSDAY MAY 17TH:

Dear Patrons,

As tomorrow is our TVCS Carnival, no parking will be permitted on school grounds after 1:00 p.m. on Thursday, May 17, 2018. We regret any inconvenience this may cause you; however we need the school parking lot for our carnival booths. If you need to park, please use the parking area that was originally part of the Marie Calendar Restaurant. The section is located directly behind the school. You can also park in the Winco Parking Lot, just be sure to make a small purchase in their store if you use their parking spaces.

As for the end of the day pick up, we will be running the student pick up as we have been doing, so nothing will change in the process. Anyone arriving after 4:30 p.m. will have to park and walk in to pick up their child, as the entire parking area and drive thru loop will be closed to traffic.

We hope to see you at the carnival, as it is a lot of fun for the entire school.

Best regards,

Tony Richard
Principal

text: Ribbon Cutting Ceremony

shared_text:
THU, OCT 12, 2017
The Village Charter School Ribbon Cutting with Governor Otter
text:
THU, OCT 12, 2017
The Village Charter School Ribbon Cutting with Governor Otter

post_text:
TVCS Parents and Families,

We will be hosting Parent Teacher Conferences after school on Thursday the 26th of October and throughout the day on Friday the 27th. There is no school for Kindergarten on the 26th; all other grades have school. Goal Setting Conferences were originally scheduled for the 13th of October, however, due to popular demand for a formal Parent Teacher Conference without students present and our Ribbon Cutting event in such close proximity, we decided to postpone Goal Setting Conferences until later in the year. You will be receiving an online sign-up form via email shortly from your student's teacher. Thank you for your flexibility and we look forward to seeing you then!

TVCS Administration
text:
TVCS Parents and Families,

We will be hosting Parent Teacher Conferences after school on Thursday the 26th of October and throughout the day on Friday the 27th. There is no school for Kindergarten on the 26th; all other grades have school. Goal Setting Conferences were originally scheduled for the 13th of October, however, due to popular demand for a formal Parent Teacher Conference without students present and our Ribbon Cutting event in such close proximity, we decided to postpone Goal Setting Conferences until later in the year. You will be receiving an online sign-up form via email shortly from your student's teacher. Thank you for your flexibility and we look forward to seeing you then!

TVCS Administration
